data.title: SPORTSBRIEFING STAFF AND WIRE REPORTS
data.meta_description: Salem tames Lisbon    SALEM — Salem defeated Lisbon 190-232 on Thursday at Salem Hills Golf Club.   Tanner James led the Quakers with a 43, followed by Keegan
data.text:
Salem tames Lisbon

SALEM — Salem defeated Lisbon 190-232 on Thursday at Salem Hills Golf Club.

Tanner James led the Quakers with a 43, followed by Keegan Sommers with a 48, Caden Arcuri with a 49 and Eli James and Traevon Washington each with a 50.

For Lisbon, Logan Sturgeon shot a 54, Devan Fox added a 55, Marshall Hall had a 57 and Brady Chamberlain finished with a 66.

Salem improves to 3-1. The Quakers will next face United Local today at Salem Hills.

Southern scores two EOAC wins

GUILFORD LAKE — Southern Local edged Wellsville and Leetonia in a tri-match on Thursday at Twin Springs Golf Course.

Southern Local had a 206, as Wyatt Bach paced the Indians with a 46, followed by Trevor Groff with a 48, Austin Harshbarger with a 53 and Preston Pitts with a 59.

Wellsville finished second with a score of 222. Landen Ramsay led the Tigers with a 44, followed by Johnnie Tice with a 53, Gage Vance with a 65 and Cooper Frank with a 62.

Leetonia placed third with a team score of 236. Jeremiah Faulk led the Bears with a 53, followed by Chase Bondi with a 50 and Christian Kelly with a 65.

Southern Local improves to 3-2 on the season.

Weekly records ace

CALCUTTA — Joyce Weekly aced Beaver Creek Meadows’ 90-yard, No. 2 with a wedge on Thursday.

She was playing with Anita Perone, Linda Danley and Bobbi Lang.

Austintown has to wait

GREENVILLE, N.C. — Austintown’s quest for Little League Softball World Series glory is on hold. The team’s match-up on Thursday with Louisiana was postponed due to Tropical Storm Debby. It will be made-up at 7 p.m. today at the East Carolina University Softball Stadium.
